intro: Trichera mutabilis, commonly known as the variable trichera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers that can change hue depending on environmental conditions. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Trichera mutabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
